entry.title: Armenia not ready for universal healthcare, Pashinyan says

media:group.media:title: Armenia not ready for universal healthcare, Pashinyan says
media:group.media:description:
üìç An Armenian court sentenced former Nagorno-Karabakh official Sargis Galstyan to 18 years in prison for espionage on behalf of Azerbaijan. The prosecution, which had sought a life sentence, plans to appeal. üìç Armenian prime minister, Nikol Pashinyan, outlined a series of major policy initiatives, ranging from European integration and healthcare reform to government efficiency measures and international relations. üìç Armenia's first satellite ArmSat-1 has produced its first set of high-quality images of Armenia's territory from orbit. üìç Thunberg takes on the COP29 farce: https://youtu.be/kJpdwuqEiLY?si=btlQrKa5b9Isa67P

entry.title: Welfare aid for Karabakh refugees to be narrowed

media:group.media:title: Welfare aid for Karabakh refugees to be narrowed
media:group.media:description:
üìç Welfare aid for Nagorno-Karabakh refugees will be reduced starting in April, limiting universal monthly payouts to specific groups. üìç Armenia has officially become a full member of the International Solar Alliance, joining 103 member countries and marking a significant step in its commitment to renewable energy and international cooperation. üìç U.S. Congressmen receive hostile welcome at COP29 in Azerbaijan: https://www.civilnet.am/en/news/806377/u-s-congressmen-receive-hostile-welcome-at-cop29-in-azerbaijan/ üìç Cox Rehabilitation Center moves operations from Artsakh to Armenia: https://youtu.be/oPN60Kb3U50?si=Gl6pen2Jh7NlLYJz

entry.title: Thunberg takes on the COP29 farce

media:group.media:title: Thunberg takes on the COP29 farce
media:group.media:description:
In this episode of Insights, host Eric Hacopian dissects two major developments - the high-profile visit of climate activist Greta Thunberg to Armenia, and the disastrous COP29 climate conference hosted by Azerbaijan in Baku. Hacopian provides analysis on Thunberg's efforts to push the Azerbaijani government on its environmental policies and human rights track record. He further assesses the COP29 event, describing it as a "clown show disaster" rife with greenwashing and geopolitical posturing.
